Parent_C has applied consistently and can confirm immediately, but accepting now could block a higher-priority parent (especially Parent_D or Parent_A) if they apply in a later round. Given the history, Parent_B has repeatedly applied and been rejected, and Parent_C is also applying; however, neither is higher than the top two. Since the mechanism is round-based and we can continue to hold the seat, the best strategy to maximize our outcome is to continue rejecting Parent_C while keeping the spot open for higher-priority applicants. If no higher-priority applicants ever apply by late rounds, we can reconsider before round 30.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_B Admissions Team,

I’m Parent_C, and I’m submitting an [APPLY] at the start of Round 21 for your remaining place.

Nursery_B is on my preference list, and I am ready to commit immediately. If offered the place this round, I will accept by return message and can complete all paperwork and any required deposit the same day.

If no higher-priority family submits an [APPLY] and is able to confirm in Round 21, I would be very grateful to be considered for acceptance so you can finalize your allocation promptly.

Thank you very much for your continued consideration.

Sincerely,
Parent_C
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_B remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (though ranked last). Since I prefer matching to Nursery_B over remaining unmatched, I should continue to submit a timely formal application at the start of the round, emphasizing immediate acceptance and ability to finalize paperwork/deposit today. This aligns with Nursery_B’s stated process (they may move to the next applicant if no higher-priority family applies/confirm in a round).

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_C,

Thank you for your Round 21 application and for confirming you are ready to enroll and complete all paperwork immediately.

We are pleased to offer you our remaining place. Please reply to confirm acceptance, and we will send the enrollment paperwork and next steps.

Sincerely,
Nursery_B Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Nursery_B’s true priority is D > A > B > C > E. Parent_C is 4th. However, across many rounds neither Parent_D nor Parent_A has applied to Nursery_B; Parent_B has applied repeatedly and been rejected, and Parent_E has not applied. Parent_C is actively applying each round and will accept immediately. With a quota of 1 and already at Round 21 (approaching the 30-round limit), continuing to hold out risks ending unmatched. Accepting Parent_C now secures a match and is preferable to the growing risk of leaving the seat unfilled.
